overview.event: American U-2 spy plane discovers Soviet nuclear missile sites in Cuba

kennedy_response.objective: Prevent Soviet military supplies from reaching Cuba
kennedy_response.demand: Removal of Soviet missiles from Cuba and destruction of missile sites

content.message: Announced naval blockade and demands for missile removal
content.tone: Firm, but aimed at avoiding escalation

agreement.secret_deal: Remove US missiles from Turkey (kept secret for 25 years)

soviet_response.consequence: Escalation of the Soviet military arsenal, but no nuclear war

resolution.outcome: End of the Cuban Missile Crisis

key_elements.element: US pledge not to invade Cuba
Secret removal of US missiles from Turkey

actions.message: Urged reexamination of Cold War myths and stereotypes, and called for a strategy of peace

teletype_hotline.description: Establishment of a direct communication link ("Hotline") between the Kremlin and the White House

nuclear_test_ban.treaty: Limited Nuclear Test Ban Treaty signed

kennedy_message.quote: “For, in the final analysis, our most basic common link is that we all inhabit this small planet. We all breathe the same air. We all cherish our children's future. And we are all mortal.”
